disease: Basal cell carcinoma of skin of unspecified parts of face

symptoms.name: Skin lesion
symptoms.pattern: A slightly transparent bump, or other forms; may be skin-colored, pink, brown, or glossy black with a rolled border

symptoms.name: Non-healing sore
symptoms.pattern: Persistent sore that does not heal

symptoms.name: New skin growth
symptoms.pattern: Appearance of a new growth on the skin

symptoms.name: Change in existing growth
symptoms.pattern: Alteration in the appearance of a pre-existing skin lesion

risk_factors: Long-term exposure to ultraviolet (UV) radiation from sunlight

required: Clinical presentation consistent with basal cell carcinoma (e.g., pearly or waxy nodule, telangiectasia, ulceration)
supportive: Histopathological examination showing characteristic features of basal cell carcinoma
